member.name: T:Octokit.EnterpriseProbe
member.summary: Service used to check if a GitHub Enterprise instance lives at a given URL.

member.name: M:Octokit.EnterpriseProbe.#ctor(Octokit.ProductHeaderValue)
member.summary: Creates a new EnterpriseProbe, used to check for the existence of GitHub Enterprise Instances
member.remarks: See more information regarding User-Agent requirements here: https://developer.github.com/v3/#user-agent-required
member.param: The name (and optionally version) of the product using this library, the name of your GitHub organization, or your GitHub username (in that order of preference). This is sent to the server as part of the user agent for analytics purposes, and used by GitHub to contact you if there are problems.

member.name: M:Octokit.EnterpriseProbe.#ctor(Octokit.ProductHeaderValue,Octokit.Internal.IHttpClient)
member.summary: Creates a new EnterpriseProbe, used to check for the existence of GitHub Enterprise Instances
member.remarks: See more information regarding User-Agent requirements here: https://developer.github.com/v3/#user-agent-required
member.param: The name (and optionally version) of the product using this library, the name of your GitHub organization, or your GitHub username (in that order of preference). This is sent to the server as part of the user agent for analytics purposes, and used by GitHub to contact you if there are problems.
The client to use for executing requests

member.name: M:Octokit.EnterpriseProbe.Probe(System.Uri)
member.summary: Makes a request to the specified URL and returns whether or not the probe could definitively determine that a GitHub Enterprise Instance exists at the specified URL.
member.remarks: The probe checks the absolute path /site/sha at the specified .
member.returns: An with either , , or in the case the request failed

member.name: F:Octokit.EnterpriseProbeResult.Ok
member.summary: Yep! It's an Enterprise server

member.name: F:Octokit.EnterpriseProbeResult.NotFound
member.summary: Got a response from a server, but it wasn't an Enterprise server

member.name: F:Octokit.EnterpriseProbeResult.Failed
member.summary: Request timed out or DNS failed. So it's probably the case it's not an enterprise server but we can't know for sure.

member.name: T:Octokit.IOauthClient
member.summary: Provides methods used in the OAuth web flow.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOauthClient.GetGitHubLoginUrl(Octokit.OauthLoginRequest)
member.summary: Gets the URL used in the first step of the web flow. The Web application should redirect to this URL.
member.param: Parameters to the Oauth web flow login url

member.name: M:Octokit.IOauthClient.CreateAccessToken(Octokit.OauthTokenRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Makes a request to get an access token using the code returned when GitHub.com redirects back from the URL GitHub login url to the application.
member.remarks: If the user accepts your request, GitHub redirects back to your site with a temporary code in a code parameter as well as the state you provided in the previous step in a state parameter. If the states dont match, the request has been created by a third party and the process should be aborted. Exchange this for an access token using this method.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOauthClient.InitiateDeviceFlow(Octokit.OauthDeviceFlowRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Makes a request to initiate the device flow authentication.
member.remarks: Returns a user verification code and verification URL that the you will use to prompt the user to authenticate. This request also returns a device verification code that you must use to receive an access token to check the status of user authentication.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOauthClient.CreateAccessTokenForDeviceFlow(System.String,Octokit.OauthDeviceFlowResponse,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Makes a request to get an access token using the response from .
member.remarks: Will poll the access token endpoint, until the device and user codes expire or the user has successfully authorized the app with a valid user code.
member.param: The client Id you received from GitHub when you registered the application.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOauthClient.CreateAccessTokenFromRenewalToken(Octokit.OauthTokenRenewalRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Makes a request to get an access token using the refresh token returned in .

member.name: M:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient.GetAll(System.String)

summary.para: List all users who are members of an organization. A member is a user that belongs to at least 1 team in the organization.
If the authenticated user is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public member will be returned.
If the requester is not an owner of the organization the query will be redirected to the public members list.

member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.

member.summary: Gets a reference for a given repository by reference name

The reference parameter supports either the fully-qualified ref (prefixed with "refs/", e.g. "refs/heads/main" or "refs/tags/release-1") or the shortened form (omitting "refs/", e.g. "heads/main" or "tags/release-1")

member.name: M:Octokit.IRepositoryHooksClient.Test(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)

member.name: M:Octokit.ITeamsClient.AddOrUpdateTeamRepositoryPermissions(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add or update team repository permissions
member.remarks: See the API Documentation for more information.
member.param: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.
The slug of the team name.
The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.
The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

The permission to grant the team on this repository. We accept the following permissions to be set: pull, triage, push, maintain, admin and you can also specify a custom repository role name, if the owning organization has defined any. If no permission is specified, the team's permission attribute will be used to determine what permission to grant the team on this repository

member.name: M:Octokit.OrganizationMembersClient.GetAll(System.String)

summary.para: List all users who are members of an organization. A member is a user that belongs to at least 1 team in the organization.
If the authenticated user is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public member will be returned.
If the requester is not an owner of the organization the query will be redirected to the public members list.

member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Octokit.ReferencesClient.Get(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a reference for a given repository by reference name
member.remarks: http://developer.github.com/v3/git/refs/#get-a-reference

The reference parameter supports either the fully-qualified ref (prefixed with "refs/", e.g. "refs/heads/main" or "refs/tags/release-1") or the shortened form (omitting "refs/", e.g. "heads/main" or "tags/release-1")

member.name: M:Octokit.TeamsClient.AddOrUpdateTeamRepositoryPermissions(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add or update team repository permissions
member.remarks: See the API Documentation for more information.
member.param: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.
The slug of the team name.
The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.
The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

The permission to grant the team on this repository. We accept the following permissions to be set: pull, triage, push, maintain, admin and you can also specify a custom repository role name, if the owning organization has defined any. If no permission is specified, the team's permission attribute will be used to determine what permission to grant the team on this repository

member.name: T:Octokit.RateLimitExceededException
member.summary: Exception thrown when GitHub API Rate limits are exceeded.

summary.para: For requests using Basic Authentication or OAuth, you can make up to 5,000 requests per hour. For unauthenticated requests, the rate limit allows you to make up to 60 requests per hour.
See http://developer.github.com/v3/#rate-limiting for more details.

member.summary: Constructs an instance of RateLimitExceededException

member.summary: Constructs an instance of RateLimitExceededException
member.param: The HTTP payload from the server

member.name: P:Octokit.RateLimitExceededException.Limit
member.summary: The maximum number of requests that the consumer is permitted to make per hour.

member.name: P:Octokit.RateLimitExceededException.Remaining
member.summary: The number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window.

member.name: P:Octokit.RateLimitExceededException.Reset
member.summary: The date and time at which the current rate limit window resets

member.name: M:Octokit.RateLimitExceededException.GetRetryAfterTimeSpan
member.summary: Calculates the time from now to wait until the next request can be attempted.
member.returns: A non-negative value. Returns if the next Rate Limit window has started and the next request can be attempted immediately.
member.remarks: The return value is calculated using server time data from the response in order to provide a best-effort estimate that is independent from eventual inaccuracies in the client's clock.

member.name: M:Octokit.GitHubClient.#ctor(Octokit.ProductHeaderValue)
member.summary: Create a new instance of the GitHub API v3 client pointing to https://api.github.com/
member.remarks: See more information regarding User-Agent requirements here: https://developer.github.com/v3/#user-agent-required
member.param: The name (and optionally version) of the product using this library, the name of your GitHub organization, or your GitHub username (in that order of preference). This is sent to the server as part of the user agent for analytics purposes, and used by GitHub to contact you if there are problems.

member.name: M:Octokit.ApiExtensions.IsTrue(Octokit.IResponse)
member.summary: Returns true if the API call represents a true response, or false if it represents a false response. Throws an exception if the HTTP status does not match either a true or false response.
member.remarks: Some API endpoints return a 204 for "true" and 404 for false. See https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/starring/#check-if-you-are-starring-a-repository for one example. This encapsulates that logic.
member.exception: Thrown if the status is neither 204 nor 404
member.param: True for a 204 response, False for a 404

member.summary: This method will create a new authorization for the specified OAuth application, only if an authorization for that application doesnt already exist for the user. It returns the users token for the application if one exists. Otherwise, it creates a new one.

See API documentation for more details.

Callback used to retrieve the two-factor authentication code from the user

member.name: M:Octokit.ApiConnection.GetQueuedOperation``1(System.Uri,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes a GET to the API object at the specified URI. This operation is appropriate for API calls which queue long running calculations and return a collection of a resource. It expects the API to respond with an initial 202 Accepted, and queries again until a 200 OK is received. It returns an empty collection if it receives a 204 No Content response.
member.typeparam: The API resource's type.
member.param: URI of the API resource to update
A token used to cancel this potentially long running request
member.exception: Thrown when an API error occurs.

member.name: M:Octokit.IApiConnection.GetQueuedOperation``1(System.Uri,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes a GET to the API object at the specified URI. This operation is appropriate for API calls which queue long running calculations and return a collection of a resource. It expects the API to respond with an initial 202 Accepted, and queries again until a 200 OK is received. It returns an empty collection if it receives a 204 No Content response.
member.typeparam: The API resource's type.
member.param: URI of the API resource to update
A token used to cancel this potentially long running request
member.exception: Thrown when an API error occurs.

member.name: T:Octokit.ProductHeaderValue
member.summary: Represents a product header value. This is used to generate the User Agent string sent with each request. The name used should represent the product, the GitHub Organization, or the GitHub username that's using Octokit.net (in that order of preference).
member.remarks: This class is a wrapper around so that consumers of Octokit.net would not have to add a reference to the System.Net.Http.Headers namespace. See more information regarding User-Agent requirements here: https://developer.github.com/v3/#user-agent-required

Specifies whether commits to a branch are required to be signed by gpg keys
Specifies whether the protections applied to this branch also apply to repository admins
Enforces a linear commit Git history
Permits force pushes to the protected branch
Allows deletion of the protected branch
The restrictions branch protection settings will also block pushes which create new branches

members.member:
Maintenance request details to enable/disable maintenance at a specified time (only applicable when enabling maintenance)
true to enable, false to disable A phrase specifying when maintenance mode will be enabled. Phrase uses humanized forms supported by the mojombo/chronic library used by the GitHub API such as "this friday at 5pm" or "5 minutes before midday tomorrow" If enabled is false, the when parameter is ignored and maintenance is turned off immediately

member.name: T:Octokit.NewMerge
member.summary: Used to merge branches in a repository.

remarks.para: The Repo Merging API supports merging branches in a repository. This accomplishes essentially the same thing as merging one branch into another in a local repository and then pushing to GitHub. The benefit is that the merge is done on the server side and a local repository is not needed. This makes it more appropriate for automation and other tools where maintaining local repositories would be cumbersome and inefficient.

member.name: T:Octokit.NewOrganizationHook
member.summary: Creates a Webhook for the organization.
member.remarks:
To create a webhook, the following fields are required by the config:
url A required string defining the URL to which the payloads will be delivered.
content_type
An optional string defining the media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.
secret
An optional string thats passed with the HTTP requests as an X-Hub-Signature header. The value of this header is computed as the HMAC hex digest of the body, using the secret as the key.
insecure_ssl:
An optional string that determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include "0" (verification is performed) and "1" (verification is not performed). The default is "0".
API: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/hooks/#create-a-hook

member.name: M:Octokit.NewOrganizationHook.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Use "web" for a webhook or use the name of a valid service. (See https://api.github.com/hooks for the list of valid service names.)

Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as 1 for true, and 0 for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewOrganizationHook.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the hook to create. Use "web" for a webhook or use the name of a valid service. (See https://api.github.com/hooks for the list of valid service names.)

member.name: P:Octokit.NewOrganizationHook.Config
member.summary: Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as 1 for true, and 0 for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewOrganizationHook.Events
member.summary: Determines what events the hook is triggered for. Default: ["push"]

member.name: P:Octokit.NewOrganizationHook.Active
member.summary: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.

member.name: T:Octokit.NewOrganizationWebHook
member.summary: Creates a Webhook for the repository.
member.remarks:
To create a webhook, the following fields are required by the config:
url A required string defining the URL to which the payloads will be delivered.
content_type
An optional string defining the media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.
secret
An optional string thats passed with the HTTP requests as an X-Hub-Signature header. The value of this header is computed as the HMAC hex digest of the body, using the secret as the key.
insecure_ssl:
An optional string that determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include "0" (verification is performed) and "1" (verification is not performed). The default is "0".
API: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/hooks/#create-a-hook

member.name: M:Octokit.NewOrganizationWebHook.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Using default values for ContentType, Secret and InsecureSsl.
member.param: Use "web" for a webhook or use the name of a valid service. (See https://api.github.com/hooks for the list of valid service names.)

Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as 1 for true, and 0 for false. Any true/false values will be converted automatically.
A required string defining the URL to which the payloads will be delivered.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewOrganizationWebHook.Url
member.summary: Gets the URL of the hook to create.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewOrganizationWebHook.ContentType
member.summary: Gets the content type used to serialize the payload. The default is `form`.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewOrganizationWebHook.Secret
member.summary: Gets the secret used as the key for the HMAC hex digest of the body passed with the HTTP requests as an X-Hub-Signature header.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewOrganizationWebHook.InsecureSsl
member.summary: Gets whether the SSL certificate of the host will be verified when delivering payloads. The default is `false`.
member.value: true if SSL certificate verification is not performed; otherwise, false.

member.summary: The supported content types for payload serialization.

secret
An optional string thats passed with the HTTP requests as an X-Hub-Signature header. The value of this header is computed as the HMAC hex digest of the body, using the secret as the key.
insecure_ssl:
An optional string that determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include "0" (verification is performed) and "1" (verification is not performed). The default is "0".
API: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/hooks/#create-a-hook

member.name: M:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Using default values for ContentType, Secret and InsecureSsl.
member.param: Use "web" for a webhook or use the name of a valid service. (See https://api.github.com/hooks for the list of valid service names.)

Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as 1 for true, and 0 for false. Any true/false values will be converted automatically.
A required string defining the URL to which the payloads will be delivered.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.Url
member.summary: Gets the URL of the hook to create.

member.summary: Gets the content type used to serialize the payload. The default is `form`.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.Secret
member.summary: Gets the secret used as the key for the HMAC hex digest of the body passed with the HTTP requests as an X-Hub-Signature header.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.InsecureSsl
member.summary: Gets whether the SSL certificate of the host will be verified when delivering payloads. The default is `false`.
member.value: true if SSL certificate verification is not performed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Octokit.NewTag
member.summary: Used to create a new tag
member.remarks: Note that creating a tag object does not create the reference that makes a tag in Git. If you want to create an annotated tag in Git, you have to do this call to create the tag object, and then create the refs/tags/[tag] reference. If you want to create a lightweight tag, you only have to create the tag reference - this call would be unnecessary.

member.name: T:Octokit.ReleaseAssetUpload
member.summary: Used to upload a release asset.
member.remarks: This endpoint makes use of a Hypermedia relation to determine which URL to access. This endpoint is provided by a URI template in the releases API response. You need to use an HTTP client which supports SNI to make calls to this endpoint. The asset data is expected in its raw binary form, rather than JSON. Everything else about the endpoint is the same as the rest of the API. For example, youll still need to pass your authentication to be able to upload an asset.

member.name: P:Octokit.ReleaseUpdate.MakeLatest
member.summary: Specifies whether this release should be set as the latest release for the repository. Drafts and prereleases cannot be set as latest. Defaults to true for newly published releases.
member.value: True set release as latest; Legacy specifies that the latest release should be determined based on the release creation date and higher semantic version.

member.name: T:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate
member.summary: Represents updatable fields on a repository. Values that are null will not be sent in the request. Use string.empty if you want to clear a value.

member.name: M:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an object that describes an update to a repository on GitHub.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.Name
member.summary: Required. Gets or sets the repository name.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.Description
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the repository description. The default is null (do not update)

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.Homepage
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the repository homepage url. The default is null (do not update).

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.Private
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to make the repository private. The default is null (do not update).

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.Visibility
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets whether the new repository is public, private, or internal. A value provided here overrides any value set in the existing private field.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.HasIssues
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable issues for the repository. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is true.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.HasProjects
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable projects for the repository. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is true.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.HasWiki
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets whether to enable the wiki for the repository. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is true.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.HasDownloads
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets whether to enable downloads for the repository. The default is null (do not update). No longer appears on the documentation but still works.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.IsTemplate
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets whether the repository is a template. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is false.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.DefaultBranch
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the default branch. The default is null (do not update).

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.AllowSquashMerge
member.summary: Optional. Allows the "Squash Merge" merge method to be used. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is true.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.AllowMergeCommit
member.summary: Optional. Allows the "Create a merge commit" merge method to be used. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is true.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.AllowRebaseMerge
member.summary: Optional. Allows the "Rebase and Merge" method to be used. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is true.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.AllowAutoMerge
member.summary: Optional. Allows the auto merge feature to be used. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is false.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.DeleteBranchOnMerge
member.summary: Optional. Automatically delete branches on PR merge. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is false.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.UseSquashPrTitleAsDefault
member.summary: Optional. Automatically set the title of squashed commits to be the PR title. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is false.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.Archived
member.summary: Optional. True to archive this repository. Note: you cannot unarchive repositories through the API. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is false.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.AllowForking
member.summary: Optional. Get or set whether to allow this repository to be forked or not. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is false.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.AllowUpdateBranch
member.summary: Optional. Get or set whether to always allow a pull request head branch that is behind its base branch to be updated even if it is not required to be up to date before merging, or false otherwise. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is false. Available since GitHub Enterprise 3.1 (2021-05-06)

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.WebCommitSignoffRequired
member.summary: Optional. Either true to require contributors to sign off on web-based commits, or false to not require contributors to sign off on web-based commits. The default when created is false.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.HasDiscussions
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets whether to enable discussions for the repository. The default is null (do not update). The default when created is false.

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.SortField
member.summary: For https://docs.github.com/search-github/getting-started-with-searching-on-github/sorting-search-results Optional Sort field. One of stars, forks, or updated. If not provided, results are sorted by best match.

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.In
member.summary: The in qualifier limits what fields are searched. With this qualifier you can restrict the search to just the repository name, description, README, or any combination of these. Without the qualifier, only the name and description are searched. https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-by-repository-name-description-or-contents-of-the-readme-file

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Forks
member.summary: Filters repositories based on the number of forks, and/or whether forked repositories should be included in the results at all. https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-by-number-of-forks

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Fork
member.summary: Filters repositories based whether forked repositories should be included in the results at all. Defaults to ExcludeForks https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-in-forks

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Size
member.summary: The size qualifier finds repository's that match a certain size (in kilobytes). https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-by-repository-size

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Language
member.summary: Searches repositories based on the language theyre written in. https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-by-language

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Stars
member.summary: Searches repositories based on the number of stars. https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-by-number-of-stars

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.User
member.summary: Limits searches to a specific user or repository. https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-within-a-users-or-organizations-repositories

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Created
member.summary: Filters repositories based on times of creation. https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-by-when-a-repository-was-created-or-last-updated

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Updated
member.summary: Filters repositories based on when they were last updated. https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-by-when-a-repository-was-created-or-last-updated

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.License
member.summary: Filters repositories based on license https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-by-license

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Archived
member.summary: Filters whether archived repositories should be included (true) or not (false). https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-based-on-whether-a-repository-is-archived

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Topic
member.summary: Filters on whether repositories are tagged with the given topic. https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-by-topic

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Topics
member.summary: Filters on the number of topics that a repository is associated with. https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-by-number-of-topics

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.CustomProperties
member.summary: Filters on repositories based on custom properties. https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories#search-based-on-repository-custom-property

member.summary: The verification URL where users need to enter the UserCode: https://github.com/login/device.

member.name: P:Octokit.OauthDeviceFlowResponse.ExpiresIn
member.summary: The number of seconds before the DeviceCode and UserCode expire. The default is 900 seconds or 15 minutes.

member.name: P:Octokit.OauthDeviceFlowResponse.Interval
member.summary: The minimum number of seconds that must pass before you can make a new access token request (POST https://github.com/login/oauth/access_token) to complete the device authorization. For example, if the interval is 5, then you cannot make a new request until 5 seconds pass. If you make more than one request over 5 seconds, then you will hit the rate limit and receive a slow_down error.

member.summary: GitHub Enterprise only, if a repo has custom pre-receive hooks. Merging is allowed.

member.summary: No conflicts, everything good. Merging is allowed.

member.name: T:Octokit.SimpleJson
member.summary:
This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/
JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the data types JsonArray(IList<object>) and JsonObject(IDictionary<string,object>). All numbers are parsed to doubles.

member.returns: An IList<object>, a IDictionary<string,object>, a double, a string, null, true, or false

member.summary: Try parsing the json string into a value.
member.returns: Returns true if successfull otherwise false.

member.summary: Converts a IDictionary<string,object> / IList<object> object into a JSON string
member.returns: A JSON encoded string, or null if object 'json' is not serializable

member.summary: Determines if a given object is numeric in any way (can be integer, double, null, etc).
